document_title: Whitmore disease (bacterial infection): Causes, symptoms, prevention
subsection_content:
During treatment, Whitmore bacteria became resistant to many common antibiotics. Therefore, if the disease is not properly diagnosed or inappropriate medication is used, the disease will progress rapidly and cause unpredictable consequences. (4)
Depending on the stage, doctors will recommend different treatment regimens:
In the early stages, doctors often prescribe intravenous (IV) antibiotics for at least 10 - 14 days, which can last up to 8 weeks.; Phase 2 of treatment can last 3 - 6 months with oral antibiotics.
After the patient completes the course of antibiotics, the chance of the disease recurring is low. However, it is necessary to follow preventive measures well so that Whitmore bacteria do not have a chance to return.
